First before I start with this review, i want to say I was very hesitant when I heard this was an anime that, like many others, was distanced from that of the manga. With that in mind, as well as having read the manga, I think that this is a great series even with a limited amount of episodes. If you do want to know the whole story, I'd recommend watching the anime first, then reading the manga.
Now then, here's the outline for my review:
STORY - So Air Gear is pretty simple when it comes to the story. You have the main character Itsuki Minami,or Ikki, who starts out as a rookie to Air Treks, but is fascinated by the sight of them and wants to become an AT master. Later on in the story, he  creates his own team to compete in "parts wars" with other AT gangs. The anime story distances itself off just a tad bit from the manga during the course of it, and that is to be expected when there is only so many episodes. It's better to have some unanswered stuff and action than thorough explanation and almost no action. Simple structure, but it gets pretty deep. 8/10


ART - Air Gear has some damn good art. Being the anime that it is, it comes to no surprise that there are thousands upon thousands of people who are huge fans of the art in Air Gear. I'm a sucker for a couple of cool looking things, but usually it isn't the art or animation that tends to win me over, and Air Gear definitely does a good job with it. It's really close to a 10 for me, but i'd say it deserves a 9/10


SOUND - This is definitely where I get the most out of this anime. The tracks and songs are spectacular. The best part is that most fight scenes have their own unique track as well (not all, but a few).  Honestly, if it weren't for both the beautiful animations and great sound, I might have dropped this anime a while down the road. Personally, You can give me any terrible anime with zero plot, but if it has a kick-ass playlist, I will watch every last minute of it. 10/10


Character - Alright, so for the I have a mixed opinion of the characters. The anime doesn't explain every (main) character in too much detail, but that is just something to be expected from an adaption of a 300+ chapter manga. With this in mind, the anime had a lot to improve upon when it comes to in depth character analysis. 


Let's start with one of my favorites: Agito/Akito. The concept of these two personalities in one body seems interesting of course, but it never was truly answered in the anime I feel. Again, there is better character analysis in the manga. For the most part, i'd say this anime has interesting characters with different backgrounds, but not good enough analysis to understand why this character matters, or why this character does this or that. 7.5/10


ENJOYMENT - Air Gear is a really fascinating anime, and almost every episode left me with the enjoyment that I was looking for. The enjoyment only started ending around the last episodes because of some unanswered stuff. Still, there are some great action scenes and interesting story details and almost no filler episodes, which is something I value a lot when it comes to any action anime. I'm glad it had 25 interesting episodes instead of 40 filler episodes out of 100 episodes. 8.5/10


OVERALL - I REALLY want to give this anime a higher rating than what I am giving it since I know the full story, but after I finished the anime in the first place, it felt empty. *NOTE: After this point, there will be spoilers. You have been warned.* 


(SPOILERS) I honestly thought the ending was rather incomplete and had no answer to what we all really wanted, which was Ikki becoming the sky king. And then what about Genesis? He intended to bring war to them, and the OVA/special kind of answers it, but I want the answer in the actual anime, not more fillers after the series is done. It was really disappointing to me since I realized I had to read through the hundred something chapters to figure out my answer. It's more of an "oh well" then a "wow that was awful" sort of thing. (/SPOILERS)


*No more spoilers.* Lastly, I will keep on saying this, but this anime is great, I enjoyed it thoroughly, it could have been better, but if you like action anime along with a good story, definitely give Air Gear a shot. 


FINAL SCORE - 8.5

Overall, pretty mediocre.
Story
Typical shounen. Kid that seems to have potential to be the best at whatever, which in this series is AT - Air Trek. Motorized... skates, I guess? There are gangs battling for power over territory and the goal is to be the king/queen of this tower.
I find the premise to be interesting enough. Air treks allowing people to perform pretty crazy stunts while battling often mid-air with rival gangs is pretty cool.
However, the whole story is pretty bland really. It's not told particularly poorly and it doesn't necessarily suffer from bad pacing... it's just bleh? Predictable in nature, as it's a shounen andfilled all the necessary stops you'd expect one to take but I never felt they landed particularly well. I did find the comedy to be quite humourous though and finished the series based on this alone. It did feel like I was going episode to episode merely for these brief moments.

As for how it wrapped up, it does essentially end in the middle of a story. Character is supposed to have this moment of great improvement but due to how bland and everything was up until then, I didn't care or revel in it with them. I don't think I would have watched a second season had they made one.


Art


Not great. 

There were times during the battles where the animation was great but then would cut back to what a pretty sub par art style. And during the last two episodes there was a noticeable dip in the quality which is hard for me to understand considering how sub par it already kind of is.

Like the story, the character designs are bland and uninspired. There are too many girls with pink hair and similar hair styles that it would take a second for me to recognize who exactly these characters were.

Something that was pretty jarring at the tail end, were shots that were... photographs of real places, i think? They'd just be a full screen photo of city scenery and characters talking of camera and then later they had drawn background with this photographed objects like lanterns and other things. I don't understand the point of it. 


Sound


Pretty standard. Nothing to bad to say about it. Did what it was supposed to. Songs were re-used far too often to set mood but they weren't bad. Just the repetition. I will say the opening intro song is hype as fuck though, I like it a lot. 


Characters


Honestly, i think characters are the biggest factor I'm gonna hold against the anime.

None of them were particularly interesting. None of them seemed to have a backstory at all or much agency to achieve what they wanted. And the ones that did have some semblance of backstory was explored all too briefly or just not interesting in the slightest.

The main character - Ikki, I found hard to cheer along for. I didn't care about him or have a desire to see him succeed. His companions were pretty funny though, which like i said earlier, it was the reason I continued to march on. Especially the guy who rides his AT's via his head.

The villains... I mean, there's the multiple gang leaders but they're either beaten and then become friends with Ikki or only present for a single episode. And their motivations are the same as Ikki's, it's hard to dislike or like them. The main villain though is peppered throughout in random episodes but also their motivations are unclear. They seem to work for a police unit wanting to make AT illegal but I never get a sense of why that is beyond the fact the gangs are fighting. I guess I don't see the justification for the use of force he opts to use.


Overall, not atrocious. Not great. Pretty squarely in the middle of the road. Had the humour not kept me going I probably would have dropped half way. In fact, I did take a break from it around episode 18 but decided I might as well finish it. I'm willing to consider that at the time of it's release, I might have enjoyed it better and a lot of the people who think of it so highly probably did see it during it's original airing or only a few years later. But i'm watching it in 2016, ten years later. And it's hard for me to recommend this to anyone over the much better shounen//sports anime old or new.

Air Gear was one of the very first anime that I’ve seen when I was younger. My only means of watching it at that time was on the television with our language dubbed. You could say it was one of the reasons that sparked my great fascination with animes.
There’s a long review coming………
About the STORY
It is very much inspired by students and delinquents who have street fights using fictional and advanced roller blades which are very Japanese-like. It is quite ridiculous yet funny that they are practically flying already with just using roller blades. I guess that’s the whole point. It can be hilarious aswell.  I am also amazed on how the mangaka was able to create a story with using roller blades. The story is pretty much cliché as we’ve seen so many stories like this. However, during it’s time, it is no doubt one of the most popular series. You could say that if it would be aired for the first time nowadays, I don’t think it can compete head on with famous series of today. It was definitely better that it aired before when this type of storylines were not overly-used yet.  The storylines might be very typical but the plot is still absolutely original. The lines made the characters cooler but it has the tendency to be so cheesy.


About the CHARACTERS

For a 26 episodes series it has a wide range of characters. Simca is absolutely the most irritating character among the characters with all her schemes and manipulations. Ikki is an example of the stereotype male protagonist who usually starts off as very weak then throughout the series becomes stronger and stronger. As cliché as it is, this kind of character is always a sure hit because it is really inspiring when we get to see characters who despite so many obstacles still manages to get stronger. It is exciting in its own way. Ikki has almost all the clichés that a male lead has. He’s like an idiot who thinks nothing but getting stronger. He shouts when his fighting and usually easily manipulated. He can be extremely irritating because of being cocky and arrogant most of the times. Like most male protagonists, he also has the strange ability to persuade his enemies and make them his ally. He also makes his own group of strong individuals. And to top it up, usually even though they are initially weak, they become strong because somehow they have very unique abilities; its either fictional abilities or just physical. Actually, these characteristics usually become very irritating however it definitely works for this type of character most especially for shonen type of stories. The very reason why until now it is still a sure hit.


About the ANIMATION and SOUNDS

The illustrations of how magnificent a particular character, is very much exciting but it has the tendency to be over the top. By the way, what’s with male protagonists having one hell of a spiky hair? Most of the famous male protagonists have spiky hairs. Does that make them a lot cooler because I really don’t think that is the case? The sounds are very much appropriate with the theme of the series which are about teenagers and delinquents. It gives a lot more spunk and hip with the series. It made every movement a lot cooler.

Air Gear is an anime that I feel people should watch for fun but haven't. It is a sports anime which is a turn off for most people but it shouldn't be.  The series is very good and enjoyable to watch.  At least that's what I said before I saw the ending of the show and met the characters.
Story:
This might take a while to explain but I will try my best.  The story focuses around Ikki, a clumsy curious teenager.  One day he discovers Air Trecks in a closet which he decides to test out. Please note Air Trecks (or theshort form of the word ATs) are basically motorized roller blades.  He decides he loves ATs and decides to recruit people into a team he created.  Teams compete against one another in battles/races to decide who is the best team (or gang whatever you prefer to call them).  This is the story of Ikki creating his team and trying to become the best around.  This story is very good and well paced with lots of sub plots that are very interesting.  The only problem is that at the end it just stops.  I kid you not the last episode just ends on filler and the main point of the story is never reached.  This ending was just a slap to the face to an above average show and ruined part of the experience.


Art:

The animation for it's time was decent.  It wasn't amazing but it wasn't terrible either it was just a little above average.  Not much else to say.


Sound: 

The music was great for the show and helped flesh out the scenes of the show. That being said I didn't find anything that stood out other than the opening for the show.  It's like the animation.  It's good but not really memorable.


Characters:

This is where it tends to fall down.  Air Gear has lots of characters that are really fun to watch and very interesting.  The problem is most characters didn't develop and had no back story.  There were a couple that were done well like Ikki, but some of them felt less like characters and more like extras.


Overall:

Air Gear despite all its flaws was very fun to watch.  I loved watching it and couldn't wait to move on to the next episode.  However this is not something for everyone.  If your looking for something enjoyable to watch and not take too seriously then stop looking.  However for everyone else despite it being a fun watch personally, the bland characters and terrible ending will turn most people off.  It's not a terrible show but it's far from being fantastic.  So in the end it's your call.  So if you want something fun to watch give it a shot.

Air gear is an exciting out going anime, but undoubtedly suffers from a lacking of an ending, due to low fan base and funding. None the less it is well made anime in my eyes. Well versed anime viewers may state that Air Gear is a little cliché, I found that the initial episodes act as stepping stones to a well planned story and is there to ease the viewer into a deeper story.  The story starts out simple, street level racing, school friends, family, and Air Trek gangs but later on  transforms into a much grander story. With hard decisions which arenot simply black and white but rather smothered in shades of grey.


Air Gear gains your attention with a combination of love triangles, protagonist achievements, memorable quotes/one liners, fan service, and comedy. Many scenes that contain "action" are done respectively in contrast to to Air Treks being motorised roller blades. 


The protagonist Itsuki (Ikki) Minami is a traditional Shounen style character who develops as the story progresses, he gets stronger and beats harder enemies. Unlike normal Shounen style characters he has a lot of human features that normal Shounen heroes seem to lack consistently. He is jealous, crude, self absorbed, lustful, sly, cunning, and even at times disturbing. These features make him relate able, and loveable (for some).       


Skankfunks use of remixes and original music complements Air Gear. The moments where a revelation occurs or an impressive trick is in motion songs like Chain - Magnificentral are played to hype the scene which it definitely does. Songs such as Chain - Acoustic Cowboy Mix produces a light mood between characters. Anthem for Pipe Dreams produces an extremely sinister atmosphere of unease which also goes for Chain - Massiveness. 


Air Gear has a lot of twists and turns, hidden secrets discover and plenty of character development though primary focus is placed on the protagonist (Shounen) attention is given to other characters as well. 


Air Gear is not for everyone that is the truth or else it would be at the top of the anime/manga list, but it's unique concept on the traditional Shounen style separates it from the rest. It is highly addictive and compelling anime, I watched 1-25 in a single night without sleep (honestly). I highly recommend Air Gear to anyone, and i hope my review allows you to see something in Air Gear others have not.

I will go on step by step on this one
Story -
1 word - Amazing! 
The way a simple equipment is developed into an intricated potential plot including, gods, championships, etc.

Art -


I will have to go with 8 here but art isn't the main feature of this anime, anyways. The animation is quite clean and modern.


Sound -


Okay, this is an anime with one of the best, if not the best, background music ever. The way it is synced with the story and scenes is brilliant!


Character -


Characters are very well defined. I mean great character development. If the 8-9 episode delay in the story has served anything, it is this (character development). By the 6th episode, i was pretty sure that all the characters are hardcore straight up PUNKS!


every character has a significance in the story and it is brilliantly shown!


Enjoyment -


9/10


It can be feel good but then intense, and then comedy/romance and then intense. I enjoyed it just like a roller coaster. Going up in anticipation, coming down like thunder but ending unsatisfying.


Overall - 


9/10 for being Dang AWESOME!


Everything was managed very well. This anime is going down in history along with Death Note and FullMetal Alchemist.


---------------


Misc -


This anime contains lots (and by lots I mean A LOT) of fan service, especially in the beggining!


The story doesn't have a proper ending, it leaves us in a particular chapter of the manga, so if you tend to get connected to something quickly and find trouble getting over it, go for the manga and not the anime.
